alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 1:31PM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE NORTHWESTERN PERMIAN BASIN, GUADALUPE, DELAWARE AND DAVIS MOUNTAINS, AND SURROUNDING FOOTHILLS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE NORTHWESTERN PERMIAN BASIN, GUADALUPE, DELAWARE AND DAVIS MOUNTAINS, AND SURROUNDING FOOTHILLS... * TIMING...This afternoon. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * RFTI...3 to 4 or near-critical, 5 to 7 or critical to extreme across Culberson County and southeastern New Mexico. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
